document_title: Chronic pancreatitis: Symptoms, causes, complications and prevention
subsection_name: viem-tuy-man-tinh.json_4_Are complications of chronic pancreatitis dangerous?
subsection_content:
Because it is an endocrine and exocrine organ, damage caused by chronic pancreatitis is difficult to restore to its original state. Pancreatic function is no longer guaranteed, negatively affecting the metabolism in the body. Patients cannot use sugar molecules in cell metabolism, leading to hyperglycemia. In addition, nutrients from food are not broken down and absorbed. Patients quickly lose weight and become physically exhausted.
In addition, chronic pancreatitis can also cause physical complications such as the formation of large pancreatic pseudocysts that do not regress on their own, leaking pancreatic fluid, causing pancreatic fluid ascites, or easily forming blood clots. in the splenic vein.
Prolonged chronic pancreatitis is also a risk factor for pancreatic cancer. At that time, the patient's life expectancy was still quite short despite early detection and aggressive radical treatment from the beginning.
Chronic pancreatitis can cause pancreatic cancer
